title.narrative: The Environment and Governance Framework for the Niger Delta-Implementation by NDSICDE

description.narrative: This project combines advocacy and social accountability approaches to achieve two main objectives: 1. To promote the clean-up of the Niger Delta and prevent oil spills and gas flaring, through improved environmental regulation and enforcement. Our work includes government engagement and a campaign to call for improved legislation (particularly the separation of environmental regulation from other aspects of oil industry regulation); promoting compliance with best practice in oil pollution response, clean-up and compensation; and improving the capacity of the Ministry of Environment to enforce regulation. SDN also supports the Bodo Mediation Initiative, which is facilitating the oil spill clean-up in Bodo community, Gokana Local Government Area. 2. To promote good governance, particularly through greater budget transparency and accountability, and working towards free and fair elections. SDN’s approach includes working directly with communities to engage with government, hold them to account, and increase citizen participation in government decision making

title.narrative: Progress of relevant environmenta l legislation, and the degree to which it reflects measures called for by SDN

comment.narrative: SDN invited to a key meeting of the House of Representatives Technical Committee on the NOSDRA Amendment Bill, where we were able to put forward recommendations. The NOSDRA Amendment Bill now includes a number of key changes which we have been lobbying for since 2014, including increased funding, increased powers to fine and penalise polluters, and the ability to conduct pipeline inspection visits; SDN was told that one of its key recommendations in a submission on the Petroleum Host and Impacted Communities Development Bill might be included in the next version of the Bill;

The Petroleum Industry Governance and NOSDRA Amendment Bills, which were passed by the outgone Nigerian National Asembly, reflected some inputs from SDN, such as increased funding for NOSDRA and to make NOSDRA the sole regulator for environmental protection in the oil industry. However, the President refused assent to these bills. SDN will work with the incoming legislature to address the concerns raised by the President and represent these.

There have been limited opportunities for political progress on and engagement with legislation given the delays in establishing new National Assembly committeees. These are now up and running and SDN met with relevant National Assembly staff in late 2019 to discuss future engagement on environmental priorities.
